content:
We will have another "social hour" at today's CTCFT! Post ideas for breakout rooms here! Don't use this topic for general chatter, though.

React to ideas you're interested in with a :+1: emoji
Idea: Discuss ideas for mentored cohorts
Idea: Lang team initiatives :)
@Jane Lusby Can I get a gamedev room?
is there still interest in a GhostCell tour / discussion or was that a joke?^^ I have like 30min after the meeting. I'm also happy to answer all your Miri questions, alternatively.
what is GhostCell?
@RalfJ I'm super interested in hearing more about GhostCell if others are.

bstrie said:

what is GhostCell?

this is the long version: http://plv.mpi-sws.org/rustbelt/ghostcell/
/me is happy to be in a lang-team initiatives room if people want that room to exist.
short version: an interior mutability data structure a PhD student at MPI-SWS / Saarland University developed that I helped them verify and we published a paper about

@RalfJ One thing I'd be interested in regarding GhostCell: what does the path look like for interior mutability with fine-grained synchronization (either locking or RCU/hazard-pointers/etc), in future research?
@Josh Triplett hm, that seems pretty orthogonal to me
@RalfJ I was thinking about how the original paper talked about the interactions with locking, and thinking about how that will evolve over time.
"the breakout rooms exist" but where do they exist ? :thinking:
crossbeam has epoch-based reclamation, possibly the other mechanisms could have a similar API
@lqd Click "Choose Breakout Room" in the bottom toolbar in Zoom.
thanks josh
@nikomatsakis can we get screen sharing enabled? that would be quite useful :D
@Jane Lusby is hosting now, but I can see if I can enable it
i think you might have killed the breakout rooms
Yeah, we may have to let them collapse and re-create them.

Josh Triplett said:

Yeah, we may have to let them collapse and re-create them.

The dungeon collapsed, fortunately we did not die.
@RalfJ thanks ralf, it was super fun and interesting
Thanks everyone, that was fun and interesting. Lovely to meet you all some more too.
Thanks everyone! I always enjoy getting to hang out with other Rustaceans during the social hour.

Chat messages in the session often contain helpful links or other information. Would it be possible for whoever is the host to publish those somewhere after the session? All chat messages are saved inside the zoom folder on one's hard drive.
:heart:
thanks to the organizers for planning this!
